qas.question: Instead of November, for what month of the following year was the release rescheduled?
What country had to wait until June of 2007 for their PS3?

context: The console was originally planned for a global release through November, but at the start of September the release in Europe and the rest of the world was delayed until <b9_0>March<b9_0/>. With it being a somewhat last-minute delay, some companies had taken deposits for pre-orders, at which Sony informed customers that they were eligible for full refunds or could continue the pre-order. On January 24, 2007, Sony announced that <b5_0>PlayStation 3<b5_0/> would go on sale on <a0_0><a4_0><b13_0>March<a0_0/> 23, 2007<b13_0/><a4_0/>, in Europe, Australia, the Middle East, Africa and New Zealand. The system sold about 600,000 units in its first two days. On <b6_0>March 7, 2007<b6_0/>, the 60 GB PlayStation 3 launched in Singapore with a price of <a3_0><b12_0>S$<b7_0>799<b12_0/><b7_0/><a3_0/>. The console was launched in <a1_0><b10_0>South Korea<b10_0/><a1_0/> on <b8_0>June 16, 2007<b8_0/>, as a single version equipped with an <a2_0><b11_0>80 GB<b11_0/><a2_0/> hard drive and IPTV.
